page.title: 17COASTLINE FAIRLIGHT E.SUSSEX
page.content:
The coastline at Fairlight, East Sussex suffers from erosion caused by weather-action on the soft sandstone clifftops. Bits of the sandstone cliff crumble away slowly, or occasionally, collapse in large chunks onto the shingle beach or into the sea
The rate of erosion is approximately twelve inches each year, and occurs in Hastings Country Park and further east at Fairlight. The Country Park is gradually losing land to the sea, and if the erosion continues at the same spots, eventually a few of the bungalows at Fairlight may be threatened.
Part of the beach affected by erosion was designated a naturist beach a few years ago as it is away from the main tourist beaches.
